intro: Draba exalata, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early summer. It is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia. Draba exalata is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is an important component of alpine flora.
